column4: Are non stripped binaries published somewhere via packages? (my firefox segfaults on Jaunty)
non stripped?
Aren't binaries stripped by default? Just assumed, still trying to attach gdb to firefox
thats a new term for me :)
oh, Meaning that symbols, location, asserts, ... are still in the blob
you usually strip before shipping, as it reduces the size of the executable
ok gotcha, thanks
cf firefox-3.5-dbg for 3.5. Can't find for 3.0 though
hmm: https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-mozillateam-bugs/2008-June/047318.html
I'm so confused between firefox-3.0-dbgsym, firefox-3.5-dbg, ... Not sure if they build them or not now
np, I thought it was strange too
04:31:05 < wgrant> pam: Debug symbols for most Ubuntu packages are on ddebs.ubuntu.com.
and ff are in that wad?  I'll have to take a peek later.  Good to know :)
Just FYI, http://pastebin.com/m7ca4a60d from #ubuntu-devel
not sure what automated symbol extraction means though actually
ah, now that makes sense
to have firefox-3.5-dbg in normal repos but not firefox-3.0-dbg? No, it doesn't :p
well 3.5 was alpha/beta until recently so my guess is someone did it prior to it hitting repo's.  So you may want to avoid that (not that you were seeking it...)
thanks, your question taught me a bunch today :)
my pleasure!
https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+question/76646
thanks...still strange what has occured if that is true.
yeah, will answer, still lost on my side :)
you're not alone :)
